course.subject: LABU
course.name: Business Case Analyses II
course.description: For students who have this course as a program requirement. This course builds on the foundation built in LABU 2051 and further develops students' ability to comprehend and analyze business cases, and eventually to present findings and recommendations clearly and persuasively.

reviews.author: Trainer
reviews.title: Best Joke in my year 2 life
reviews.comment_content:
Shit content except the first task.
1. Financial Planning (Imagine that you are working in AIA, Manulife... looks like insurance1001)
2. Write an email x2
3. Consultant for a Yacht Club
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fair enough as she did not teach anything useful due to the shit content. Blowing water with her would be the only content.

But she has mentioned, I dont care any quantitative stuff but I will measure you on how your express it.

So should I add tons of virtual assets like FTX, Luna into the portfolio?
reviews.comment_grading:
I will say, everyone in RMBI, have tried to receive at least one A range in previous lang course or even transferred. But the grade is relatively unreasonable. Hardly can we receive an A range result, if we are not the top 2 person in our sections, say bye to your grade.

I get a B range, but I think we, RMBI students, deserve a better grading system, at least let us know that how worse do we perform in the first presentation. However, Jessie never disappoints us in terms of giving us a bad grading:)

Hopefully next generation can get back into labu 2040 and get a more decent grade from there :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Prep with 2 presentations with ppt is fair enough.
But you need to know that it is a only 2 cred course.
It is more like 3 cred course.

reviews.author: DHKENNY
reviews.title: Smiley Killer
reviews.comment_content:
Same as the previous year

My comment:
Totally useless. Not sure why they developed this course. The program office should just merge the RMBI students into normal LABU courses.

This course taught a bunch of useless content that will not apply in reality if you are an RMBI student. For instance, why would I need to write an apology letter to customers if I am not a CS? I don't think most RMBI students will become CS or "公關". This course has no risk management-related stuff except for financial consulting. However, it is still very qualitative, probably becoz the lecturer is from LC.
reviews.comment_teaching: TBH, Jessie is quite patient and willing to answer questions. However, the course content is not meaningful, so her teaching doesn't matter much.
reviews.comment_grading:
Terrible Grading. It's one of the courses that RMBI students have a dogfight. I got A range in both year 1 LANG courses but B and C range in LABU. Why the hell are we following a standard course grading but not an honor course grading scheme?
Even Qfin students are just taking LABU2040 and 2060. It would be great if we were just taking the normal LABU course.

Also, Jessie will like to catch your minor mistakes, so be careful about that. Her focus is on how to act but not on effective communication.
reviews.comment_workload: Preparing for the presentations is a bit heavy for a 2 cred course. The emails tasks are light but it took time to prepare for the meaningless presentations.

reviews.author: Tina Du
reviews.comment_content:
1. mock financial consulting for a retiring couple
2. email writing for West Indies Yacht Club Resort case
3. group presentation for West Indies Yacht Club Resort case

The first task did involve lots of useful contents. However, the mock consulting was not quite realistic. We had to talk for only 7-8 mins nonstop without communication...... And the financial model involved was  not properly assessed. So the final task was kind of absurd and unrealistic.

The second and the third tasks were interesting but kind of obsolete. It would be better if we had learned more or practiced more with good examples besides the final presentation and final email submission.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessie was really patient, responsive and careful. You can feel free to talk or email to her if you have any questions.
But in fact, I expected more industrial experience for each case, instead of correcting minor mistakes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Perhaps because the whole class was composed of RMBI students, it's really really hard to get good grades. I have to admit that I feel my efforts were not paid-off on the transcript. It's sad. :(
Not sure how to be in A range. But I suppose if you are a perfectionist and set really high standards for yourself, it's still possible to outperform in each presentation and assignment. Be careful about any minor mistake. Good luck!
reviews.comment_workload:
It won't be hard to finish all the assignments.
However, if you don't want to receive a bad grade, I would suggest to prepare extremely well and practice the same thing over and over again.

reviews.author: Cathleen
reviews.title: Killed
reviews.comment_content:
Three assessments
Financial consulting: helping a pair of old couple choose an MPF.

Email: learning how to lie and making up excuses to shift responsibilities for damn quality of service

Presentation: informing how lazy the workers are and make up suggestions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Always smiling but makes you feel knife behind.
Somewhat ok in class but quite sleepy.
reviews.comment_grading:
Follow every instruction she gave.
The grade is similar to LABU2051
Shxt grade always
Don't feel good about getting 'competent'

Competent means: C range
;)
reviews.comment_workload:
Meaningless course with 3 assessments.
Workload is manageable

reviews.author: MC
reviews.comment_content:
finanial consultation, a group of 2 30%
email writing, individual 15%x2
presentation, a group of 3 or 4 30%

the content changes every year

email writing and presentation is based on the case study on West Indies Yacht Club Resort
there is a lot of reference on the internet which is very helpful for the presentation, it saves you a lot of time on reading the case
reviews.comment_teaching:
i don't like his teaching
he wants you to complete all activity sheets during class and you need to speak in class to get participation marks

he will add you as friends on facebook and open a group for the labu session and will make announcement in the group
reviews.comment_workload:
remember to speak in class
make him remember you

reviews.author: KF
reviews.comment_content: Mainly three criteria: Marketing Case (Clocky), Finance Case (Financial Planning for Retirees), and Capstone Case (Chow Tai Fook). Around 3 to 4 sessions for each case. Focus on language usage much more than content and technicality.
reviews.comment_teaching: Derek is nice and speaks english well. He tried to make everyone contribute and make use of technology during and even after class, like using Facebook for homework submission.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mostly based on the three tasks score and class participation (well, impression counts quite a lot for all language courses at UST). Marketing case was individual writing task, Finance one was 2-2 consultation, you can pick a partner yourself to work with. Final Capstone was a group presentation. Again, can pick group members by ourselves.

Derek did not really give us feedback for the later two tasks. If you get an average of 5 to 6 and participate well in class, should not be a problem for getting A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy as a 2 credit course. But you will feel the pressure usually just right before each assessment deadline.

reviews.author: V.lylit
reviews.comment_content:
Purely content-wise: one management case, one marketing case (aka short sales pitch) and the capstone case.

Skills-wise: report-writing skills (tone, formality, cohesiveness, e.t.c.), presentation skills (eye contact, posture - stand properly!, hand gestures - observe and sometimes you'll see people making circles with their hands repeatedly, but such gestures don't come with specific purposes... and a lot more)

Side dish: music by Vivaldi (he seems to be quite a die-hard fan of Vivaldi...)
reviews.comment_teaching: Levi is quite friendly and conducts the class quite well.  There isn't a lot of nonsense in the class, and he would insist on you speaking in English - this is an English class after all. He would also aid you with the Q&A part of the presentations by telling you what questions he would be asking beforehand.  With that said though, you still gotta prepare well for all the 5 questions because you'll never know which 2 he would end up asking you.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is alright... not much that I can say, but good participation helps.  Discuss calmly and don't argue with him -  it may cost you some score the next time you present.  Also, you may want to ask questions that he could solve because, as you see, I asked him a rather sharp question around the time of capstone presentation and I still haven't gotten any answer (it's august already).

More importantly, here are some of his pet peeves:
- "It is observed/suggested/sth that...": What does that "it" refer to? Nothing.
- ppt slides with lots of animations and colors
- the combination of dark background and light-colored (or even white) words on top
- pronouncing keywords wrong (of course it's no good but it will cost you a lot in his class)
reviews.comment_workload: Three pieces of assignments don't seem to be a lot of work but if you count the time needed to read the assignments, write up the report/ script/ powerpoint, coordinate with your group to form a good flow, rehearse, and prepare the questions... it can still take up a lot of time.  Not to mention if you end up facing free-riders or intragroup conflicts.

reviews.author: hikaarie
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly teaches you how to do presentations to customers or clients. There is almost no additional teaching and most are common senses except for using concise wordings when replying to emails.
reviews.comment_teaching: Levi is friendly and tends to joke a lot in class. But he did not provide much guidance when doing the assignments and preparing for the presentations.
reviews.comment_grading: Poor grading. Levi emphasis on pronunciation and delivery. For presentations, Levi tends to give satisfactory to students with local accents. For email, the grading is better since it focus only on wordings.
reviews.comment_workload: Two group oral presentations and one email writing. Group is randomly assigned. However, first presentation is based MPF funds and requires the excel to decide which fund to purchase.

reviews.author: BER
reviews.comment_content: This course is compulsory for all Business students. Similarly, it is indeed very practical, including amending your CV, shaping your interview skills, and pitching an idea.
reviews.comment_teaching: Hong Kong tutor, not too pushy. As I remembered, Eunice worked in ibank before. She has some experiences conducting real-life interviews. will get quite a lot insight on this aspect. You can also ask her for personal opinion regarding your future job application.
reviews.comment_grading: the mark given is not too high but the grade turns out  quite good
reviews.comment_workload: acceptable,seems better than the other 2 LABU courses.

reviews.author: Wes
reviews.title: easygoing tutor
reviews.comment_content: Content is all the same among all classes. Perhaps Nick should arrange time better since we have one less lesson to talk about the business email writing. Others are just fine. And the materials prepared by the language department are outdated, so everyone can assume they were in that decade (2010) and presented some existing ideas in 2015. Those are fine but better ask tutor before.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nick is extremely easy-going. You can do everything in class other than speaking in Cantonese. And if you are in his 9am class then he will frequently be late by 15 minutes and have breakfast for another 10 min, so it is quite relaxing actually.
reviews.comment_grading: As mentioned before, I just asked him if i can pretend I was in 2010 and give some suggestion which are common in 2016, and at last he let me do like this.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 presentation + 1 email writing + 2-3 quiz before class.
For some quiz that should be checked during class, Nick would not check so it might be alright to do it in front of him I think.
And for some presentation practice, it is OK not to be prepared of that. Some can even hold a script. So don't be too serious with that.

reviews.author: VIRose
reviews.comment_content: Teach you how to present your solution towards a case. Didn't learnt a lot from the lessons but from own research.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since the content isn't much useful, Ben couldn't teach much, but he did quite nice overall and he's very friendly.
reviews.comment_grading: I didn't perform well in the first presentation but quite good at the second one. I asked him where did i did wrong and i corrected it and i get an A-. my writing is average, so the grade is ok
reviews.comment_workload: Just like LABU2051, but with quizzes to submit in the lessons.

reviews.author: AshLEE
reviews.comment_content: It's similar to LABU 2051 (2 presentations) but with different cases and an email writing assignment. The cases are interesting and helped me a lot to have a quick peek into the related industries.
reviews.comment_teaching: She knows what she's teaching. Being experienced with another instructor the previous semester, I was highly satisfied with how clearly she put out the words, chose the right materials for each class and how quickly and appropriately she provided feedback to each student.
reviews.comment_grading: She is a fair grader. A good impression on your presenting style and skills might help, but it's almost always more about how much effort you put into your research, contents and verbal and gesture language.
reviews.comment_workload: Depends on how deep you would like to go with the pre-presentation research and practice, but overall, comparatively light workload.

reviews.author: omg918
reviews.comment_content: It is about business case analysis which want to train your presentation skills and writing skills. It just like other lang courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: Leo is a very nice tutor. His lesson is very interesting and he gives very good grade. We have to form groups every lesson for discussion activities.
reviews.comment_grading: He gives me the best grade among the 4 lang courses that I have taken. My essay is 6 6 5 out of 7 7 7. One of my presentation got 5 overall and one got 6 overall. And I got A at the end. My group mate all got A range at the end
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair. There is one essay and 2 group presentations. If you want to get good grade, you need to send more time on practicing with your group mates. Having good group mate is very important. But you have to attend lesson as attendance score is very important. You will fail if you skip more than 2 lessons. Participation score is important as well. You have to participate actively in class like answering the tutor's questions and share your ideas actively in class.

reviews.author: Stetanjung
reviews.comment_content: If you have taken LABU 2051, this will be super similar.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He's quite nice and he teaches very clearly.

Every tutorial, he gives some customized PPTs and some examples. He is really active and believes the two-way method of teaching. He gives lots of exercises to train us well before the real presentations, and he does give us supporting comments related to them.

Though a lot of people relates his name with 'King of Killer (KK)', I can say that I don't say so.
reviews.comment_grading:
He gives a fair grade, really.

As long as he knows you are an active student in class, you will be fine. You just have to be brave and talk a lot in the class. Though I admit he has a pretty high standard for the students (typical non-local teacher, maybe?)
reviews.comment_workload:
1 essay and 2 presentations (one of them is Capstone project)

At the beginning, the workload seems to be very light, although as the semester is coming to the end, it can be pretty overwhelming.

If you have awesome groupmates, you will be fine. However, if you have freeriders, you need to work a little harder, especially on the brainstorming part to find the solution.

reviews.author: Schneider
reviews.comment_content: one written report about stating and solving the problems for a company. Two presentations about making a business plan for a travel agency. Usually, the business case study is around 10-11 pages. The content is not hard and it is about the tourism in hong kong which we are familiar with.
reviews.comment_teaching: mini presentation in every lesson, nearly no homework every week. The tutor used powerpoint slides to teach.
reviews.comment_grading: my performance was a bit higher than average, but the grade is not that good. I was given  B- and other classmates that i knew got C+ or B-.
reviews.comment_workload: just 2 presentations and 1 written report. The workload is not too heavy. But it takes time to prepare for the presentation, especially you need to read the materials for the presentations.

reviews.title: heavy workload
reviews.comment_content:
business case study 每份通常10-11版
one written report
2 case presentation
reviews.comment_teaching:
每堂有mini presentation
有mini homework每堂
其他instructor應該相對少
powerpoint slide教學
經常overrun, 幾有心教
要你留心聽書 唔係印象分會好差
reviews.comment_grading:
melissa算係好grade的labu instructor
我班d人起碼有2個a range 大量b range

attendance
1 report
2 case presentation
唔可以走堂
走堂就最高c range
reviews.comment_workload:
workload唔可以話大
但每堂都有d野要準備就真係幾麻煩下
同埋你個course 係主要train 你presentation skills
因為 present個陣係唔可以拎任何note card etc.
report就好d 可以係屋企做
經常要約group mate 出黎開會
所以都會識到下同學仔咁

reviews.author: asfasfasfasf
reviews.comment_content: The course basically teaches you how to present a financial plan for your client and solve cultural and various problems in a resort.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching was ok, not too boring. At least she knows what she is talking about and when you need help, you can tell she is willing to help and gives concrete suggestions.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grade as long as you do everything properly and maintain a good attendance record. Answer questions every now and then would be grand to show your presence in the class.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fine, just two presentations and one essay. I think it's a pretty manageable and easy course per se.

reviews.author: SmallPotato
reviews.title: Killer
reviews.comment_content:
教既野同LABU2051差唔多
都喺旨在提升presentation & speaking skills
但d堂上activities 大部分都冇用, train唔到之餘浪費時間
聽講有d好既老師唔會逐個逐個死跟activities, 而喺上堂播下得意野跟住鼓勵學生分享, 傾下計咁.
但唔好彩既就只有悶到等落堂.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liza喺Singaporean, 曾透露自己5字頭@@
本身佢對assignment就有好多extra but vague requirements, 比分相比之下就好嚴謹同picky
出分偏慢, 佢講左要睇至少兩三次video tape 捉錯處, 之後先比分.
上堂就偏悶... 好多人都喺上網/溫midterm
reviews.comment_grading:
冇走過堂, 上個sem 本來有A , 今次Kill到死死下得B. 本身上堂吹水都有人話佢killer, 但一派grade就知真喺知衰. 佢自己都話coordinator就killer傳聞同佢傾過,之後就強調自己唔喺killer, 喺Fair instructor...  
問present group mates 都話grade比以前差左. 我諗小程度上可能喺當時有幾個non-local喺度屈機... 搞到被比下去
reviews.comment_workload:
workload本身一般, 但佢喺最後一個task叫我地提前做好d presentation, 跟住正式present前一個禮拜做定powerpoint 上堂抽group 做唔計分既present 跟住叫同學比comments.

同埋每次present都會叫同學self-evaluate & evaluate 其他組既表現, 跟住email比果組人睇. 變相多左workload, comments有冇用就見仁見智, 但咁短時間睇住d唔到肉既comment 都好難突飛猛進, 加上killer比分 都好難話因而升到grade.
